greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of primitive inequivalent sublattices of square lattice having mirrors parallel to the diagonals of the unit cell of the parent lattice of index n.
comment: After a(2), this matches A034380 except for n = 63, 65, 80, 85, ... - _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 27 2009 [Updated by _Andrey Zabolotskiy_, May 09 2018]
link: Andrey Zabolotskiy, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
J. S. Rutherford, Sublattice enumeration. IV. Equivalence classes..., Act. Cryst. A65 (2009) 156-163, Table 5 symmetry *mm2.
formula: a(n) = 2^(A046072(n)-1) for n>2. Thus a(n) = 1 if n>2 is in A033948, a(n) = 2 if n is in A272592, etc. (End)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Feb 25 2009
ext: New name and more terms from _Andrey Zabolotskiy_, May 09 2018
